Roast Beef

Ingredients:

  • 3-4 pound beef roast (sirloin or ribeye)
  • Salt and pepper
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped (optional)

Procedure:

  1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. Season the beef roast generously with salt and pepper on all sides.
  3. In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, minced garlic, and chopped rosemary (if using).
  4. Rub the garlic-rosemary oil all over the beef roast.
  5. Place the beef roast in a roasting pan or a cast iron skillet.
  6. Roast the beef in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until the internal temperature of the thickest part of the beef reaches 135°F (57°C) for medium-rare, 145°F (63°C) for medium, or 160°F (71°C) for well done.
  7. Remove the beef from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.
  8. Serve and enjoy!
